title: What are the pros and cons of being gifted and talented in the performing arts? - Quora

response.answer_text: What are called gifted or talented people can have a head start if they have the kind of talent that allows them to do everything right the first time they try—that is both a pro and a con, in that it might indeed give them a head start, but if it is too easy and instinctive, they might have trouble later if the instinct fails them or if they need to learn something new for which they don’t have a talent, such that they are disinclined to practice and persevere until they achieve it. For some people, if something comes easily to them, they don’t want to work on it to make it better, but are merely content to rely on their talent, so they do not improve.

I’m a found materials artists but feel the creative process is similar in that it’s a bit of an emotional rollercoaster. Full of highs and lows, even success can be bittersweet in that it might bring feelings of what next? How can i top my last gig/artwork? The high of the initial inspiration is followed by how do i start? How do I accomplish that? Can i actually make this happen? What if it actually happens?
